result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Delon Earnest Hardy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Delon Earnest Hardy.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea  hearing.  Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, room 313 of the courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea hearing. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (9 pages) commencing 04-21-22 by DANIELLE HOLCOMB.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wisconsin State Patrol A. Medina.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender's office has appointed counsel in this matter - the Court will vacate order appointing counsel at county expense.
Stephen Sargent; filed.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Status Conference. Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Justin Padway, not present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for Preliminary Hearing,  Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court held colloquy with defendant. The court will appoint Attorney Justin Padway. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court reinstates bail of $750.00.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy not in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Pretrial Services Supervision (DISCHARGE) Report; filed.
Indigency hearing on March 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Delon Earnest Hardy in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Delon Earnest Hardy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant AS TO COUNT 3, reserving defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT'S ELIGIBILITY IS BASED UPON HIS INCOME STATUS.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
